name: NewmanPostman
friendlyName: Newman the cli Companion for Postman
description: Using Newman, one can effortlessly run and test a Postman Collections directly from the command-line. Now in a task!
author: Carlo Wahlstedt

inputs.name: collectionSourceType
inputs.label: Collection Source Type
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify either to use file(s) as collection or url (eg : shared collections)

inputs.name: collectionFileSource
inputs.label: Collection File Source
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path to the folder containing collection file source(s)

inputs.name: Contents
inputs.label: Contents
inputs.helpMarkDown: File paths to include as part of the collection run. Supports multiple lines of match patterns.

inputs.name: collectionURL
inputs.helpMarkDown: Url to shared collection

inputs.name: folder
inputs.label: Folder
inputs.helpMarkDown: Run requests within a particular folder in a collection

inputs.name: environmentSourceType
inputs.label: Environment Source Type
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify either to use file(s), url (eg : shared environment) or nothing as environment

inputs.name: environment
inputs.label: Environment File
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path to the Postman environment file as JSON

inputs.name: environmentUrl
inputs.label: Environment Url
inputs.helpMarkDown: URL to the Postman environment file as JSON

inputs.name: globalVariables
inputs.label: Global
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path to the Postman global variables file as JSON

inputs.name: globalVars
inputs.label: Global Variables
inputs.helpMarkDown: Global variables to provide to command line in a key=value format. Multiple values can be added.

inputs.name: dataFile
inputs.label: Data
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path to the data source file as CSV

inputs.name: numberOfIterations
inputs.label: Number of Iterations
inputs.helpMarkDown: Define the number of iterations to run [number]

inputs.name: pathToNewman
inputs.label: Path to Newman
inputs.helpMarkDown: Use if your build agent can't find newman automatically and you want to specify the path

inputs.name: unicodeDisabled
inputs.label: Disable Unicode
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify whether or not to force the unicode disable option. When supplied, all symbols in the output will be replaced by their plain text equivalents.

inputs.name: forceNoColor
inputs.label: No color
inputs.helpMarkDown: Turn off usage of color in terminal output.

inputs.name: delayRequest
inputs.label: Delay Request
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify a delay (in ms) between requests [number]

inputs.name: ignoreRedirect
inputs.label: Ignore Redirect
inputs.helpMarkDown: Prevents newman from automatically following 3XX redirect responses.

inputs.name: bail
inputs.label: Stop on first error
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify wether or not to stop a collection on first error

inputs.name: bailmodifier
inputs.label: Option
inputs.helpMarkDown: 'folder' will stop collection execution in case of incorrect folder configuration, 'failure' will gracefully stop collection on first test failure

inputs.name: sslClientCert
inputs.label: SSL Client Cert
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path to the ssl client cert

inputs.name: sslClientKey
inputs.label: SSL Client Key
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path to the SSL Client Key

inputs.name: sslStrict
inputs.label: Disable Strict SSL
inputs.helpMarkDown: Disables strict ssl

inputs.name: reporters
inputs.label: Reporters
inputs.helpMarkDown: Format of report. Multi selection allowed.

inputs.name: reporterHtmlTemplate
inputs.label: Reporter Html Template
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path to html template file

inputs.name: reporterHtmlExport
inputs.label: Reporter Html Export
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify a path where the output HTML file will be written to disk. If not specified, the file will be written to newman/ in the current working directory.

inputs.name: reporterHtmlExtraTemplate
inputs.label: Reporter Html Extra Template
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path to html extra template file

inputs.name: reporterHtmlExtraExport
inputs.label: Reporter HtmlExtra Export
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify a path where the output HTMLExtra file will be written to disk. If not specified, the file will be written to newman/ in the current working directory.

inputs.name: htmlExtraDarkTheme
inputs.label: Enable HTML Extra Dark Theme
inputs.helpMarkDown: Use this optional flag to switch the reporter template to the Dark Theme dashboard.

inputs.name: htmlExtraLogs
inputs.label: Enable HTML Extra Console Logs
inputs.helpMarkDown: Set this optional flag to enable additional console logs from the reporter.

inputs.name: htmlExtraTestPaging
inputs.label: Enable pagination.
inputs.helpMarkDown: Use this optional flag to add pagination to the tests in the request view.

inputs.label: HTML Extra Report Title
inputs.name: htmlExtraReportTitle
inputs.helpMarkDown: This optional flag can be used to give your report a different main Title in the centre of the report. If this is not set, the report will show Newman Run Dashboard.

inputs.name: reporterJsonExport
inputs.label: Reporter Json Export
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify a path where the output JSON file will be written to disk. If not specified, the file will be written to newman/ in the current working directory.

inputs.name: reporterJUnitExport
inputs.label: Reporter JUnit Export
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify a path where the output JUnit file will be written to disk. If not specified, the file will be written to newman/ in the current working directory.

inputs.label: Custom reporter name
inputs.name: customReporter
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of custom reporter to output result. If non empty will be added to the list of reporter. See Newman doc for details.

inputs.name: timeoutGlobal
inputs.label: Timeout
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify entire collection timeout (in ms) to complete [number]

inputs.name: timeoutRequest
inputs.label: Timeout Request
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify a request timeout (in ms) for a request [number]

inputs.name: timeoutScript
inputs.label: Timeout Script
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify a request timeout (in ms) for script to complete [number]

inputs.name: exportEnvironment
inputs.label: Export Environment
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify a path where the environment variables file will be output before completing a run

inputs.name: exportGlobals
inputs.label: Export Globals
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify a path where the global variable files will be output before completing a run

inputs.name: exportCollection
inputs.label: Export Collections
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify a path where the collection file will be output before completing a run
